name: Makefile tab vs space indentation
description: LLM uses spaces but Makefile requires tabs for commands
original:
CC=gcc
CFLAGS=-Wall -Wextra -std=c99
SRCDIR=src
OBJDIR=obj
SOURCES=$(wildcard $(SRCDIR)/*.c)
OBJECTS=$(SOURCES:$(SRCDIR)/%.c=$(OBJDIR)/%.o)

all: myapp

myapp: $(OBJECTS)
	$(CC) $(OBJECTS) -o $@

$(OBJDIR)/%.o: $(SRCDIR)/%.c
	@mkdir -p $(OBJDIR)
	$(CC) $(CFLAGS) -c $< -o $@

clean:
	rm -rf $(OBJDIR) myapp
expected:
CC=gcc
CFLAGS=-Wall -Wextra -std=c99
SRCDIR=src
OBJDIR=obj
SOURCES=$(wildcard $(SRCDIR)/*.c)
OBJECTS=$(SOURCES:$(SRCDIR)/%.c=$(OBJDIR)/%.o)

all: myapp

myapp: $(OBJECTS)
	$(CC) $(OBJECTS) -o $@ -lm

$(OBJDIR)/%.o: $(SRCDIR)/%.c
	@mkdir -p $(OBJDIR)
	$(CC) $(CFLAGS) -c $< -o $@

clean:
	rm -rf $(OBJDIR) myapp

metadata.failure_reason: LLM used spaces for command indentation but Makefiles require tabs
